titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the South Africa Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:02

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of printed material, audio recordings, and memorabilia relating to current political, economic, and social conditions in South Africa. The majority of the material pertains to the African National Congress and the first democratic election of April 27, 1994.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: South Africa Collection (MS 1559). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The original accession is arranged alphabetically by organization, title of publication, or personal name. A small section of subject files is included at the end of the accession. Additions to the collection may vary in arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The South Africa Collection consists of printed material arranged alphabetically by organization, name, personal name, or title of publication. A small number of subject files are included at the end of the collection. Additions to the collection may vary in arrangement.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection, MS 605; Pamphlet Collection, MS 1351; African Postcard Collection, MS 1575; South African Apartheid Collection, MS 1500; South African Poster Collection, MS 1574. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of printed material and memorabilia relating to the bid put forth by the city of Cape Town to the International Olympic Committee to host the summer games of the XXVIII Olympiad in the year 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of material pertaining to the 1999 political elections in South Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of printed materials and related items pertaining to the World Conference against Racism, Racial Discrimination, Xenophobia, and Related Intolerance, held in Durban, South Africa, from August 28 through September 1, 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of printed materials which are alphabetically arranged by organization, personal name, or title of publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.
